info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 2:16PM AST until July 14 at 5:15PM AST by NWS San Juan PR
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...Northern San Juan.
* WHEN...Until 515 PM AST.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 213 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to El Yunque Streamer. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Juan, Old San Juan. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON
